documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
is not “no one may
choose,” but only “Icannot choose,” and indeed not even this, but “Iwill
not act,” leaving it open that somebody else can or should, and in particular
that  anyone  in  a  position  of  authority,  with  the  job  of  securing  people’s
rights, both can and should. So this is no difficulty. I have not been arguing
that any given third party must accede to the mother’s request that he per-
form an abortion to save her life, but only that he may.
I suppose that in some views of
